comments.body:
CI failure due to python 2.4 syntax error:

```
2017-02-14 21:07:55 Compiling ./setup.py ...
2017-02-14 21:07:55   File "./setup.py", line 14
2017-02-14 21:07:55     with open('requirements.txt') as requirements_file:
2017-02-14 21:07:55             ^
2017-02-14 21:07:55 SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```
setup.py shouldn't be checked for py2.4 support.  It will only run on py2.6+ as it is controller only

Ah yes, good catch. It will need to be added to the python 2.4 compile skip list:

https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/test/compile/python2.4-skip.txt

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +12,16 @@    sys.exit(1)

with open('requirements.txt') as requirements_file:
    install_requirements = requirements_file.read().splitlines()
    if not install_requirements:

comments.body: @abadger are there any real cases where README is stripped off the distribution?
Oops,  didn't se this before merging.  I don't see a reason.  that we need to check for README.rst to exist.  @StephenWeber  do you remember if there was a reason you had that in there?

There wasn't a reason, it probably came along from the example sources I referenced for this kind of work - there is probably some "safety first" reasoning but I can't imagine this failing (or necessarily wanting it to succeed if the file's not present).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +162,166 @@    with open('README.rst', 'r') as readme_file:
        longdesc = readme_file.read()
except (IOError, OSError):
    longdesc = ('Ansible is a radically simple IT automation system. It handles'
                ' configuration-management, application deployment, cloud provisioning, ad-hoc'
